comments.body:
Maybe move this up closer to line 1570 (just after). You're not using `_get_stacked_values` since this is modifying the state of `self._pos/_neg_prior` right?

And would this be equivalent to `(if y_values >= 0).all() and not self.subplots: self_pos_priors = y_values`? and then the branch for `y_values <= 0`. Then you can get rid of the `else: pass` since you're guaranteed to have calculated `y_values` which would raise if there was a mix or positive and negatives.

Considering area plot, it can't be moved to ahead of `plotf`. At the timing `plotf` called, `y_value` stores the y-coodinates of line, and `_pos_prior` or  `_neg_prior` stores starting points of area filling. Thus, changing `_pos_prior` or `_neg_prior` must be done after `plotf` called.

And condition is not equivalent as `(if y_values >= 0).all() and not self.subplots`. The starting point should not be increased when stacking is disabled. 

Regarding `else` section, it can be removed (I included to note that it cannot occur though)
Same thing here with the `data` to `frame` change.
